meanings.definition: A loud ringing sound, like that of bells.
meanings.sent1: The pealing of the church bells filled the air with joy.
meanings.sent2: The pealing of the doorbell announced the arrival of guests.
meanings.sent3: The pealing of laughter echoed through the room.
meanings.sent4: The pealing of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.
meanings.sent5: The pealing of the school bell marked the end of the day.

meanings.sent1: We could hear the pealing of the bells from miles away.
meanings.sent2: The sudden pealing of the phone startled me.
meanings.sent3: The pealing of the fire alarm sent everyone into a panic.
meanings.sent4: The pealing of the trumpet signaled the start of the parade.
meanings.sent5: The pealing of the gong signaled the end of the meditation session.

meanings.sent1: The church bells pealing in the distance created a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the bells pealing as the newlyweds exited the church.
meanings.sent3: The children's laughter pealing through the playground was contagious.
meanings.sent4: Her voice pealing with excitement as she shared the good news.
meanings.sent5: The thunder pealing in the storm made the windows rattle.
